content.body: https://lists.webkit.org/pipermail/webkit-dev/2008-October/005442.html
oops. sorry.
stupid focus issues.
I love the latest lastweek post
olliej: yes, thanks
good lord
i've had better network connectivity on aircraft over the pacific
Hixie: is it that bad today?
uhm, yeah, 2.4 second lag on IRC says so
8% packet loss, round-trip min/avg/max/stddev = 240.488/710.241/1033.070/166.841 ms
>500ms pings to the router in the hotel, let alone anywhere useful
I can't get a ping to/from router
so next year's meeting might be at the scmariott.com hotel
i notice on their front page:
that they are a TAG approved hotel
maybe we should start approving hotels too!
do we really want to get in the endorsing hotel business? :p
:P
I guess we need sane bed, sane breakfast, and good free wifi
not the order i would have put them in, but yes
Hixie: What do you want to know if we're discussing?
i'm following the minutes on irc
Hixie, which meeting are you in today?
css right now
What colour should we paint the bikeshed?
multicoloured
it should have no colour
transparent?
or it can absorb all colors equally in the spectrum of visible (and invisible) light
s/equally/completely/
ok. When we can get totally non-reflective black paint, sure
black body bikeshed
anyone know of a CLI browser with Javascript support?
gsnedders, elinks?
doublec: Copy in Debian doesn't support it, and I can't be bothered compiling a browser from scratch just to do one bloody thing
Hixie: Facebook doesn't work either, seemingly
is trying IE
The progress bar is moving, at least
If it has any meaning :P
And now stuck, waiting for server to never respond
hsivonen: yt?
network...
annevk4: is Henri around?
yes
where?
should I summon him elsewhere?
webapps
OK
Hixie: I'm here now
hsivonen: can you come to room 135? knock on the door
I'm supposed to be in the PF room at 14
Hixie: is room 135 a meeting rrom or a hotel room?
looking for the rom now
so is anything interesting happening over there?
my meeting is basically over
Hixie, ^^
Hixie, you might want to check http://www.w3.org/QA/2008/10/normative-references-conformance.html#c167608
thought Hixie said CSSWG was discussing HTML5
annevk4: i said counters. :-) which might affect html5
I understood headers/sections too
yeah they said something about html5 headers in the minutes
i'm guessing they'll get to that
ok, cool
I'll continue reading chairs and Member-only lists meanwhile
anything interesting?
chairs continues to be interesting
yeah i'm reading that
loves the internet
i'm sitting in a room with a device that has no wires coming off it
i'm in france
yet i'm copying files from my girlfriend's laptop to our mac mini in our living room in the us
(there's a firewall on both sides, which is even cooler, since it means i have to tunnel things between a third machine over ssh)
anyone @tpac know where gsnedders or BenMillard might be?
notes Hixie is not unique in that :)
smedero: CSS room for Ben
hsivonen: thanks!

thinks it would be cooler if you didn't have to involve four separate machines just so that you (can watch videos from your living room | have backups | remove incriminating evidence | whatever you're doing)
smedero, gsnedders should be at your hotel
smedero, he was a bit sick
annevk4: ahh, bummer. thanks for the info.
smedero, you around now?
yep, in the lobby
(of the pullman)

The "security image" anti-phishing technique would be much more effective if it wasn't possible for phishing sites to say "Recent update: We have listened to our customers, and to streamline our login process we have removed the need for the security image. Please just enter your username and password: [____] [____] [OK!]"
Philip`: Or just proxy the image in the case of openID ;)
Philip`: moving videos from carey's laptop to our mac mini so that she has spare room on her hard drive :-)
Hixie: Ah, so the problem is just that the internet is rubbish, so you're still reliant on legacy concepts like local data storage
smedero, ok, CSS is discussing paged media
smedero, I've the feeling I made a mistake going in :)
heh.
especially since Ben was suggesting to play frisbee
Philip`: hmmmmmm i guess!
(Paged media? Is that when it's too large to all fit in RAM at once?)
I figured at this late in the day, there isn't much point in me observing CSS or anything else
lol
Philip`, it's about killing trees
and slideshows
Oh, good, I don't like trees
oh the wifi here is lovely.
annevk4: Can't you just ask 'please sir can I go to the toilet?' and then run off and play frisbee?
I always found that was a quite effective tactic
That's so... british
smedero, are you still in the lobby?
timbl, good you're here, I was wondering if I'm still signed up for a panel or not and whether I should prepare something other than being around
Lachy: yep, going through 24+ hours of missed email
smedero, ok. This css stuff is boring me. I'm going to come out shortly
annek4, I don't think unless whoever is moderating it has said otherwise you need to prepare a talk.
annek4,..  might be a good idea to find others on teh panel beforehand and get to know them a bit
timbl, so you were basically nominating me yesterday, I wasn't sure whether that was serious
sorry, seems it was
I should have checked the agenda first
If you don't want to do it don't.  But you have been vocal about philosophy of html5.  So have hixie and henri d
s/ s/ d
smedero, are you upstairs or downstairs?
timbl, ok
Lachy: I'm downstairs, next to the casino entrance... wearing a black long sleeved shirt.
This sounds like a spy movie
we're in casino royale
well, royale casino to be fair, but that's less fun
Could make for some exciting (completely fictional) reports afterwards
is chaals onlien anywhere?
many of his "must"s in progress events make little sense to me
Are there any known UA issues for creating an element inside in HTML4
not to my knowledge but i doubt it is widely tested
